Key Match Events: The Los Angeles Dodgers suffered a 10-2 blowout loss in Game 2 of the NLDS against the San Diego Padres.
Freddie Freeman exited the game in the sixth inning due to ankle discomfort.
Pre-Game Insights: Max Muncy expressed confidence in the Dodgers' talent despite the uncharacteristic performance in Game 2.
Post-Match Reflections: Max Muncy described the Dodgers' performance as's--t' in Game 2.
The Dodgers' manager Dave Roberts said Freddie Freeman's status remains uncertain for Game 3.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Dodgers have been eliminated from the postseason in the NLDS in each of the last two years despite winning 100 or more games in the regular season.
Others: The Dodgers face a deficit of three runs or more in two consecutive games.
